trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of the GORE® PI 13-05 Device for the Treatment of Occlusive Disease in the Common and External Iliac Arteries
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Feasibility Evaluation of the GORE® PI 13-05 Device for the Treatment of Occlusive Disease in the Common and External Iliac Arteries

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - PI 13-05
Experimental: PI 13-05 -
Treatment: devices: PI 13-05

primaryOutcome.outcome: Composite safety endpoint measured as a percentage,tallying all subjects experiencing any of the events as a failure

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary objective of the GORE® PI-13-05 clinical study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of PI 13-05 for the treatment of arterial occlusive disease in patients with de novo or restenotic lesions in the common and/or external iliac arteries.
